resources.string:
I work for Org-Quest Research Limited (OrQuest), a survey firm. We are conducting a research study in coordination with IPA on technology and innovation in firms. The study is conducted jointly with the researchers from World Bank, Columbia University, and Johns Hopkins University. As you previously completed a survey with us few months back, you are eligible to participate in this exercise. The exercise will help us learn what you expect will change for a Leather Goods or Footwear firm similar to yours if it replaces the clutch motor on one sewing machine with a servo motor. We will begin with questions about your existing sewing machines and then ask you about different scenarios where a clutch motor is replaced by a servo motor. Please keep in mind that we want to understand what you think will be the impact of this replacement on a Leather Goods or Footwear firm similar to yours. Participating in this exercise will help you earn a maximum bonus of Tk 9000. I will go through all the rules with you thoroughly so that your firm has the best chance of acquiring a bonus amount. The process will take about 15 minutes. If you complete the full exercise, you will have a chance of receiving a cash amount in your firm’s Mobile Money Account at the end of the study in 2023.
\n\nDo you have any questions? Do you agree to participate in the exercise?

“For each of the questions that we will ask you in the exercise, we would like you to imagine that you have 10 matchsticks to allocate to different number ranges shown on the screen based on the probability that you think a specific event will happen. One matchstick represents 10 percent or a 1 in 10 chance. As you add matchsticks, it means that you think the event is more likely to happen. For example, if you put two matchsticks in a range, it means you think there is a 20 percent or a 2 in 10 chance of this outcome happening. If you pick 5 matchsticks, it means that you think there is a 50 percent chance (or a 5 in 10 chance) of this outcome happening and if you put all 10 matchsticks in a range, it means you are certain this will be the outcome.”


There is no right or wrong answer, we just want to know what you think for a Leather Goods or Footwear Firm similar to yours.


I want to go through a practice exercise with you first. This will help you understand the structure of the full exercise. I will go through all the steps in detail. I am happy to go through the information as many times as you need, so please ask me questions at any stage.

You will get a bonus for participating in the game. The bonus will be increased based on each matchstick you assign in the correct box. The bonus will be reduced based on how many matchsticks you assign in the incorrect boxes.
1. As of 20 July 2021, the Bangladesh Cricket team has played 388 ODI (One-day International) matches. How many matches out of 388 ODIs has the Bangladesh Cricket team won?
2. As of 2019, what % of the population or how many people out of every 100 has access to electricity in Bangladesh?"
3. What was Bangladesh’s approximate export earnings in US$ from the leather, leather goods and footwear sector in the year 2019?

You have completed the practice exercise. We will now move to the main exercise, which will help us learn what you expect will change for a Leather Goods or Footwear Firm similar to yours, if it replaces the clutch motor on one sewing machine with a servo motor. We will ask you
Page 4 of 5
3 questions. While answering please keep in mind that we are asking these questions for a Leather Goods or Footwear firm similar to yours.
Q1. For a firm similar to yours, how many units of electricity (kWh) does one sewing machine with a clutch motor use in an average day with an eight-hour shift and normal scheduled breaks?

Q2. For a firm similar to yours, if clutch motor on that same machine is replaced by a servo motor, how many units of electricity (kWh) do you think this machine will use in an average day with an eight-hour shift and normal scheduled breaks?
Q3. What is the price of electricity per unit (kWh) for a firm like yours?
Thank you for your time.\nHave a good day.
